intro: Hieracium laterale, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Hieracium laterale is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
